title: Hi!

excerpt: Checking in on the blog after some time away, plus my latest project: a free clothing closet for my hometown!
text: Hi! Been a while! Iâ€™m sitting at a coffee shop right now in the Outer Banks desperately trying to avoid a presentation I need to put together for a new project (shout out to Ashleyâ€™s Espresso Parlour!), and realized itâ€™s been a while since we last chatted. So hello! Whatcha been up to over there? Anything new and juicy going on this Summer? :) Itâ€™s been a hot mess here in the DC area with all the govâ€™t cuts and confusion and chaos. Everyone here knows someone â€“ or is someone â€“ affected by these changes, and it doesnâ€™t seem to be getting any betterâ€¦ Weâ€™ve somehow managed to avoid a bulk of it so far (my wife is a proud â€“ and hard working! â€“ civil servant), however the walls are closing in which is sad as itâ€™s her favorite job in the entire world and sheâ€™d be devastated having to walk away ğŸ¥º But we keep going and just do whatever we can within our control! Aside from that, life is going pretty well. Our 3 boys continue to grow and be their silly little selves (who now care awfully a lot about clothes and brands and influencers â€“ even my 7 year old!), and Iâ€™m still practicing retirement and failing pretty hard at it, hahaâ€¦ I â€œworkâ€ just as much now as I did before, though it is on my own time and for no pay, so I suppose itâ€™s kinda like real retirement? :) Itâ€™s been a blast though. I accidentally started a new project a few months back and itâ€™s since taken a life of its own: A free clothing closet in my hometown, giving out clothes and essentials to anyone who needs it! It mainly caters to our neighbors living on the streets and in the woods, but also a lot of our lower income families as well. Weâ€™ve given out over 10,000 items so far, from clothing to bikes to tents, sleeping bags, hats, shoes, feminine products, you name it. Itâ€™s so different from running an *online* project where youâ€™re sharing ideas worldwide and never see anyone face to face, compared to this one which is so hyper focused and only deals with physical products being shared IN PERSON! I even had to get back onto Facebook after a decade away as everyone in this town communicates there, lololâ€¦ Okay, well that and Instagram, but still. Itâ€™s like going back in time and having to unlearn a whole way of doing business ğŸ˜‚ On one side itâ€™s been great â€“ the project is flourishing and thereâ€™s no end in sight, but on the other it hurts my heart as it only proves that thereâ€™s such a need for this in the community :( And not only mine, but probably yours too as well as all around the country/world! And it only seems like itâ€™s getting worse with how things are playing outâ€¦ Since when is food and clothing a nicety and not necessity?! But oh wellâ€¦Â  Canâ€™t say I ever saw myself going into this line of business, lol, but if thereâ€™s one thing Iâ€™ve learned over the years, itâ€™s to keep going when youâ€™re onto something and everything keeps flowing :) Whether thatâ€™s a new project or a relationship or even your finances. Thereâ€™s something magical that happens when your passions align with your skills, especially if it happens to solve a problem in the world. So when the universe tells you youâ€™re on the right path you keep pushing because youâ€™re right where youâ€™re meant to be at this point in time! Itâ€™s a beautiful thing! So thatâ€™s what Iâ€™ve been up to over here! And now gotta stop procrastinating and get back to work :) This presentation I have to put together is for a local organization who wants to donate a bunch of clothes â€“ and hopefully money so I can get a sprinter van and turn this into a mobile closet! â€“ and I need to convince them Iâ€™m not a psycho, hahaâ€¦ If anyone wants to learn more about the closet, and/or wants to donate yourself (yes please!!), DM me and Iâ€™ll tell you more ğŸ™ In the meantime, Iâ€™ll try to get back to some sort of rhythm here on the blog! I should have more time as the kids start going back to school here over the next couple monthsâ€¦ If youâ€™re new to the site and this is the first post youâ€™re reading, hello!! Thanks for giving it a shot! :) You can check out â€œmy storyâ€ here, and feel free to reach out anytime with questions or just to say hi. We usually do talk more about money than my personal life, haha, but it probably wonâ€™t be the last time either. Have a fantastic week! PS: That other project Iâ€™m helping my friend with is still moving forward (YouBots.ai), but proving to be more of a long haul than we thought. On the plus side, the Project of Me is still going strong! PPS: Here are 3 fantastic books Iâ€™ve read recently if anyoneâ€™s interested: â€œThe Happiest Man on Earthâ€ by Eddie Jaku â€œThe Tattooist of Auschwitzâ€ by Heather Morris â€œ10% Happierâ€ by Dan Harris *Links are Amazon affiliate linksâ€¦ (Visited 547 times, 23 visits today) Get blog posts automatically emailed to you!
html:
Hi!

Been a while!

Iâ€™m sitting at a coffee shop right now in the Outer Banks desperately trying to avoid a presentation I need to put together for a new project (shout out to Ashleyâ€™s Espresso Parlour!), and realized itâ€™s been a while since we last chatted. So hello! Whatcha been up to over there? Anything new and juicy going on this Summer? :)

Itâ€™s been a hot mess here in the DC area with all the govâ€™t cuts and confusion and chaos. Everyone here knows someone â€“ or is someone â€“ affected by these changes, and it doesnâ€™t seem to be getting any betterâ€¦ Weâ€™ve somehow managed to avoid a bulk of it so far (my wife is a proud â€“ and hard working! â€“ civil servant), however the walls are closing in which is sad as itâ€™s her favorite job in the entire world and sheâ€™d be devastated having to walk away ğŸ¥º But we keep going and just do whatever we can within our control!

Aside from that, life is going pretty well. Our 3 boys continue to grow and be their silly little selves (who now care awfully a lot about clothes and brands and influencers â€“ even my 7 year old!), and Iâ€™m still practicing retirement and failing pretty hard at it, hahaâ€¦ I â€œworkâ€ just as much now as I did before, though it is on my own time and for no pay, so I suppose itâ€™s kinda like real retirement? :)

Itâ€™s been a blast though. I accidentally started a new project a few months back and itâ€™s since taken a life of its own: A free clothing closet in my hometown, giving out clothes and essentials to anyone who needs it!

It mainly caters to our neighbors living on the streets and in the woods, but also a lot of our lower income families as well. Weâ€™ve given out over 10,000 items so far, from clothing to bikes to tents, sleeping bags, hats, shoes, feminine products, you name it.

Itâ€™s so different from running an *online* project where youâ€™re sharing ideas worldwide and never see anyone face to face, compared to this one which is so hyper focused and only deals with physical products being shared IN PERSON! I even had to get back onto Facebook after a decade away as everyone in this town communicates there, lololâ€¦ Okay, well that and Instagram, but still. Itâ€™s like going back in time and having to unlearn a whole way of doing business ğŸ˜‚

On one side itâ€™s been great â€“ the project is flourishing and thereâ€™s no end in sight, but on the other it hurts my heart as it only proves that thereâ€™s such a need for this in the community :( And not only mine, but probably yours too as well as all around the country/world! And it only seems like itâ€™s getting worse with how things are playing outâ€¦ Since when is food and clothing a nicety and not necessity?!

But oh wellâ€¦Â  Canâ€™t say I ever saw myself going into this line of business, lol, but if thereâ€™s one thing Iâ€™ve learned over the years, itâ€™s to keep going when youâ€™re onto something and everything keeps flowing :) Whether thatâ€™s a new project or a relationship or even your finances. Thereâ€™s something magical that happens when your passions align with your skills, especially if it happens to solve a problem in the world. So when the universe tells you youâ€™re on the right path you keep pushing because youâ€™re right where youâ€™re meant to be at this point in time! Itâ€™s a beautiful thing!

So thatâ€™s what Iâ€™ve been up to over here!

And now gotta stop procrastinating and get back to work :) This presentation I have to put together is for a local organization who wants to donate a bunch of clothes â€“ and hopefully money so I can get a sprinter van and turn this into a mobile closet! â€“ and I need to convince them Iâ€™m not a psycho, hahaâ€¦

If anyone wants to learn more about the closet, and/or wants to donate yourself (yes please!!), DM me and Iâ€™ll tell you more ğŸ™

In the meantime, Iâ€™ll try to get back to some sort of rhythm here on the blog! I should have more time as the kids start going back to school here over the next couple monthsâ€¦

If youâ€™re new to the site and this is the first post youâ€™re reading, hello!! Thanks for giving it a shot! :) You can check out â€œmy storyâ€ here, and feel free to reach out anytime with questions or just to say hi. We usually do talk more about money than my personal life, haha, but it probably wonâ€™t be the last time either.

Have a fantastic week!

PS: That other project Iâ€™m helping my friend with is still moving forward (YouBots.ai), but proving to be more of a long haul than we thought. On the plus side, the Project of Me is still going strong!

PPS: Here are 3 fantastic books Iâ€™ve read recently if anyoneâ€™s interested:

  • â€œThe Happiest Man on Earthâ€ by Eddie Jaku
  • â€œThe Tattooist of Auschwitzâ€ by Heather Morris
  • â€œ10% Happierâ€ by Dan Harris

*Links are Amazon affiliate linksâ€¦
